com.example.currencyrates

Class CurrencyRatesService.RatesDownloader

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.os.AsyncTask<String,Long,String>
      • com.example.currencyrates.CurrencyRatesService.RatesDownloader
  • Enclosing class:
    CurrencyRatesService

    private class CurrencyRatesService.RatesDownloader
extends android.os.AsyncTask<String,Long,String>
    The async job, which will be performed in order to call the Revolut API and get the Currency Rates. The raw data will be converted and broadcast to each subscriber. NOTE: Once the job is done, the AsyncTask cannot be reused. To reused it, create new instance of it.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nikola Georgiev

    • Method Detail

      • doInBackground

        protected String doInBackground(String... urls)
        Override this method to perform a computation on a background thread. The specified parameters are the parameters passed to AsyncTask.execute(Params...) by the caller of this task.

        This method can call AsyncTask.publishProgress(Progress...) to publish updates on the UI thread.

        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class android.os.AsyncTask<String,Long,String>
        Parameters:
        urls - The parameters of the task.
        Returns:
        A result, defined by the subclass of this task.
        See Also:
        AsyncTask.onPreExecute(), onPostExecute(java.lang.String), AsyncTask.publishProgress(Progress...)

      • onPostExecute

        protected void onPostExecute(String data)

        Runs on the UI thread after doInBackground(java.lang.String...). The specified result is the value returned by doInBackground(java.lang.String...).

        This method won't be invoked if the task was cancelled.

        Overrides:
        onPostExecute in class android.os.AsyncTask<String,Long,String>
        Parameters:
        data - The result of the operation computed by doInBackground(java.lang.String...).
        See Also:
        AsyncTask.onPreExecute(), doInBackground(java.lang.String...), AsyncTask.onCancelled()
